description: The practice of providing clear and comprehensive documentation for software interfaces to ensure proper usage.

name: Component-and-connector structures
label:LABEL: ArchPattern
description: A category of architectural structures that focuses on the components of a system and the interactions between them.

name: Module structures
label:LABEL: ArchPattern
description: A category of architectural structures that organizes software into modules, promoting separation of concerns.

name: IAnimatable
label:LABEL: CodeStructure
description: An interface that defines methods for animatable objects, showcasing the use of interfaces in design.

name: Decomposition Structure
label:LABEL: CodeStructure
description: A structure that shows how modules are recursively decomposed into smaller modules, aiding in understanding and design.

name: Administrative Interface
label:LABEL: CodeStructure
description: An interface that provides administrative functionalities, often used in system management.

name: Component-and-Connector Structure
label:LABEL: CodeStructure
description: Shows the system as a set of elements that have runtime behavior (components) and interactions (connectors).

name: Interelement Communication
label:LABEL: CodeStructure
description: The method by which different elements of a system communicate, which must be managed for security and performance.

name: Authorization Mechanism
label:LABEL: CodeStructure
description: A specialized element introduced into the architecture to manage access control and enhance security.

name: Architecture Debt
label:LABEL: DesignPrinciple
description: A concept referring to the implied cost of additional rework caused by choosing an easy solution now instead of using a better approach that would take longer.

name: Real-time Requirements
label:LABEL: ArchPattern
description: Architectural considerations that ensure a system can process data and respond to inputs within a strict time constraint.

name: High-Reliability Requirements
label:LABEL: QualityAttribute
description: Requirements that ensure a system operates continuously and correctly, often critical in safety and mission-critical applications.

name: MTBF
label:LABEL: QualityAttribute
description: Mean Time Between Failures, a metric used to measure the reliability of a system.

name: MTTR
label:LABEL: QualityAttribute
description: Mean Time to Repair, a metric that indicates the average time taken to repair a system after a failure.

name: Stimulus
label:LABEL: DDDConcept
description: An event arriving at the system that triggers a response, relevant in defining quality attribute scenarios.

name: Module Decomposition
label:LABEL: CodeStructure
description: A basic architectural structure that involves dividing a system into modules to manage functionality and responsibilities.

name: Functional Suitability
label:LABEL: QualityAttribute
description: The degree to which the software provides functions that meet stated and implied needs.

name: Quality Attribute
label:LABEL: QualityAttribute
description: A characteristic that affects the quality of the software, such as maintainability, scalability, performance, security, and reliability.

name: Tactics-Based Questionnaire
label:LABEL: CodeStructure
description: A tool used to analyze and understand quality attribute behavior at various stages of architecture design.

name: Design Decisions
label:LABEL: CodeStructure
description: Specific choices made in the architecture to support quality attributes, including where these decisions are implemented in the code base.

name: Architecture Maturity
label:LABEL: QualityAttribute
description: The level of development and refinement of the architecture, impacting the accuracy of quality attribute analysis.

name: Code Modules
label:LABEL: CodeStructure
description: Components of the codebase that implement specific tactics to support quality attributes.

name: Frameworks
label:LABEL: CodeStructure
description: Concrete realizations of patterns that provide a structure for building applications.

name: Subsystem
label:LABEL: CodeStructure
description: A modular component of the system that encapsulates specific functionality, such as Customer Account or Package Delivery.
source: Systems Analysis and Design in - John W. Satzinger, Robert B. Ja.pdf

name: Module Decomposition Structure
label:LABEL: CodeStructure
description: A structure that organizes code into modules, reflecting team structures and aiding in project organization.

name: Map-Reduce Pattern
label:LABEL: DesignPattern
description: An architectural pattern that processes large data sets in parallel by dividing the task into map and reduce phases.

name: Deployment Structure
label:LABEL: ArchPattern
description: Defines how software elements are allocated to hardware and communication pathways, relevant for reasoning about performance and security.

name: Quality Attribute of Deployability
label:LABEL: QualityAttribute
description: Refers to the ease with which a software system can be deployed in a specific environment.

name: Degraded Operation
label:LABEL: QualityAttribute
description: The ability of a system to continue functioning in a limited capacity when sensors fail or provide unreliable data.

name: Logging Mechanism
label:LABEL: CodeStructure
description: A component responsible for recording system events and faults for later analysis.

name: Notification System
label:LABEL: CodeStructure
description: A component that alerts users or systems about faults or important events.

name: Recovery Tactics
label:LABEL: DesignPattern
description: Strategies implemented to restore the system to normal operation after a fault.

name: Time to Repair
label:LABEL: QualityAttribute
description: A measure of the duration required to fix a fault in the system.

name: Time to Detect Fault
label:LABEL: QualityAttribute
description: A measure of how quickly the system can identify a fault.

name: Timestamp
label:LABEL: DesignPattern
description: A tactic used to detect incorrect sequences of events in distributed systems by assigning local clock states to events.

name: Sanity Checking
label:LABEL: DesignPattern
description: A tactic that checks the validity or reasonableness of operations or outputs of a component based on internal design knowledge.

name: Parameter Typing
label:LABEL: DesignPattern
description: A design pattern that employs a base class to define functions for handling type-length-value formatted message parameters, ensuring sender-receiver agreement on content types.

name: Timeout Tactic
label:LABEL: QualityAttribute
description: A tactic that raises exceptions when timing constraints are not met, enhancing system reliability.

name: Self-Test
label:LABEL: QualityAttribute
description: A quality attribute tactic where components or subsystems run self-checks to ensure correct operation, contributing to system reliability.

name: Redundant Spare
label:LABEL: DesignPattern
description: A design pattern that involves duplicate components taking over tasks if the primary component fails, enhancing system availability.

name: Rollback
label:LABEL: DesignPattern
description: A design pattern that allows the system to revert to a previous known good state upon failure detection, ensuring system reliability.

name: Retry Tactic
label:LABEL: DesignPattern
description: A design pattern that involves retrying operations that may fail due to transient faults.

name: Reconfiguration
label:LABEL: DesignPattern
description: A design pattern that involves reassigning responsibilities to functioning components to maintain system functionality after failures.

name: Shadow Mode
label:LABEL: DesignPattern
description: A design pattern that allows a previously failed component to operate in a monitoring state before being fully reintroduced.

name: Rollback Mechanism
label:LABEL: DesignPattern
description: The ability to revert HDFS to a previous state using snapshots, enhancing reliability.
source: The Architecture of Open Source Applications 1.pdf

name: Degradation Policy
label:LABEL: QualityAttribute
description: A quality attribute that defines how a system maintains critical functions in the presence of component failures.

name: System Monitor
label:LABEL: CodeStructure
description: A component responsible for monitoring the state of health of other parts of the system, detecting failures or congestion.

name: Active Redundancy
label:LABEL: ArchPattern
description: An architectural pattern where all nodes in a protection group process identical inputs in parallel, allowing for quick failover.

name: Passive Redundancy
label:LABEL: ArchPattern
description: An architectural pattern where only active members process input traffic, providing periodic state updates to redundant spares.

name: Cold Sparing
label:LABEL: ArchPattern
description: An architectural pattern where redundant spares remain inactive until a failover occurs, leading to poor recovery performance.

name: Circuit Breaker Pattern
label:LABEL: DesignPattern
description: A pattern that prevents cascading failures in distributed systems by stopping requests to a failing service until it is reset.

name: Process Pairs Pattern
label:LABEL: DesignPattern
description: A pattern that employs checkpointing and rollback to ensure a backup can take over in case of failure.

name: Forward Error Recovery Pattern
label:LABEL: DesignPattern
description: A pattern that allows a system to move forward to a desirable state without reverting to a previous state, often using error-correction capabilities.

name: Canary Testing
label:LABEL: QualityAttribute
description: A deployment strategy that allows real users to test new software versions with minimal risk, enhancing reliability and performance.

name: A/B Testing
label:LABEL: QualityAttribute
description: A method for comparing two versions of a product to determine which performs better, focusing on user experience and engagement.

name: Blue/Green Deployment
label:LABEL: ArchPattern
description: A deployment strategy that reduces downtime and risk by running two identical production environments.

name: Granular Deployment
label:LABEL: QualityAttribute
description: Refers to the ability to deploy the whole system or elements within a system, reducing certain risks.

name: DevSecOps
label:LABEL: ArchPattern
description: An architectural approach that integrates security into the DevOps process, relevant for deployment in secure environments.

name: Feature Toggle
label:LABEL: DesignPattern
description: A design pattern that allows enabling or disabling features at runtime without redeploying the application.

name: Deployment Pipeline
label:LABEL: CodeStructure
description: A structured approach to automate the deployment process, including scaling rollouts and managing service interactions.

name: Package Dependencies
label:LABEL: CodeStructure
description: A method of bundling an application with its dependencies to ensure consistent deployment across environments.

name: Rolling Deployment
label:LABEL: ArchPattern
description: An architectural pattern that allows gradual rollout of new releases to minimize risk.

name: Service Mesh
label:LABEL: CodeStructure
description: A dedicated infrastructure layer that facilitates service-to-service communications in a microservices architecture.

name: Sidecar
label:LABEL: CodeStructure
description: A design pattern that allows additional functionality to be added to a service without modifying its code.

name: Deployability
label:LABEL: QualityAttribute
description: The quality attribute that focuses on the ease and speed of deploying software changes and updates.

name: Fault Detection Tactics
label:LABEL: CodeStructure
description: Techniques used to identify failures in a system, such as ping/echo and heartbeat.

name: Recovery Point Objective (RPO)
label:LABEL: QualityAttribute
description: The maximum acceptable amount of data loss measured in time, used to set checkpoint intervals.

name: Recovery Time Objective (RTO)
label:LABEL: QualityAttribute
description: The maximum acceptable amount of time to restore a system after a failure.

name: Component Marketplace
label:LABEL: CodeStructure
description: A structure that allows for the distribution and integration of software components.

name: Authentication/Authorization Service
label:LABEL: CodeStructure
description: A specific service that handles user authentication and authorization, often used in various applications.

name: CI/CD Infrastructure
label:LABEL: ArchPattern
description: An architectural pattern that automates the integration and deployment of software, enhancing deployability.

name: Scale Rollouts
label:LABEL: DesignPattern
description: A deployment strategy that gradually releases new features to a subset of users to minimize risk.

name: Toggle Features
label:LABEL: DesignPattern
description: A pattern that allows features to be turned on or off without deploying new code.

name: Power Monitor
label:LABEL: DesignPattern
description: A pattern that monitors and manages system devices to minimize active time, thereby saving energy.

name: Service Mesh Pattern
label:LABEL: ArchPattern
description: A design pattern that manages service-to-service communications in a microservices architecture, often used to reduce network traffic.

name: Discovery Services
label:LABEL: CodeStructure
description: Services that help in locating and managing microservices in a distributed system, often adding overhead to the architecture.

name: Service Interaction Management
label:LABEL: DesignPattern
description: A design tactic that focuses on managing interactions between services to ensure proper communication and functionality.

name: Resource Monitoring
label:LABEL: DesignPattern
description: A design pattern that involves dynamically classifying devices and computational resources to optimize energy consumption.

name: Dynamic Scheduling
label:LABEL: DesignPattern
description: A design pattern that allows for the dynamic scheduling of computational resources based on energy efficiency and task priorities.

name: Reduce Resource Demand
label:LABEL: DesignPrinciple
description: A design principle that emphasizes the importance of consistently attempting to reduce resource demand in software systems.

name: IoT Device Design
label:LABEL: ArchPattern
description: An architectural consideration that focuses on the constraints and requirements of designing software for Internet of Things devices.

name: Removal from Service
label:LABEL: DesignPattern
description: A tactic for temporarily taking a system component out of service to mitigate potential system failures.

name: ACID Properties
label:LABEL: DesignPrinciple
description: A set of properties (Atomicity, Consistency, Isolation, Durability) that ensure reliable transactions in distributed systems.

name: Predictive Model
label:LABEL: QualityAttribute
description: A model used to monitor system health and predict faults based on operational performance metrics.

name: Exception Prevention
label:LABEL: DesignPattern
description: Techniques employed to prevent system exceptions, including the use of exception classes and error-correcting codes.

name: Syntactic Dependency
label:LABEL: DesignPrinciple
description: A type of dependency that is based on the syntactical relationships between modules or components, such as function calls or inheritance.

name: Temporal Coupling
label:LABEL: DesignPrinciple
description: A form of coupling where components are dependent on the timing of their interactions, often leading to hidden dependencies.

name: Semantic Coupling
label:LABEL: DesignPrinciple
description: The inherent coupling that exists in the problem domain, which must be modeled in the architecture.

name: Intermediary
label:LABEL: ArchPattern
description: A pattern used to break dependencies between components or between components and the system, facilitating integration and reducing direct coupling.

name: Integrability Tactics
label:LABEL: DesignPattern
description: Strategies aimed at reducing costs and risks associated with integrating new components and managing existing ones.

name: Integration Environment
label:LABEL: CodeStructure
description: The state of the system during the integration process, which can affect how components are integrated.

name: Component Configuration
label:LABEL: CodeStructure
description: The arrangement and settings of components within a system that influence their integration.

name: Response Measure
label:LABEL: DesignPrinciple
description: Metrics used to evaluate the effectiveness of the integration process and the system\'s response.

name: Abstract Common Services
label:LABEL: DesignPattern
description: A design pattern that abstracts common services to provide a unified interface for different components, enhancing integrability.

name: Resource Manager
label:LABEL: CodeStructure
description: A specific form of intermediary that governs access to computing resources, ensuring fair access and resource management across components.

name: Resource Distance
label:LABEL: DesignPrinciple
description: A principle that emphasizes reducing the distance between a system and its resources to improve efficiency and management.

name: Horizontal Scalability
label:LABEL: QualityAttribute
description: A type of scalability that involves adding more resources to logical units, such as adding servers to a cluster.

name: Vertical Scalability
label:LABEL: QualityAttribute
description: A type of scalability that involves adding more resources to a physical unit, such as increasing memory in a single machine.

name: Elasticity
label:LABEL: QualityAttribute
description: The ability of a system to dynamically allocate and release resources based on current workload.

name: Variability
label:LABEL: QualityAttribute
description: The ability of a system to support the production of different variants of its components.

name: Modifiability Tactics
label:LABEL: DesignPrinciple
description: Strategies aimed at improving the modifiability of software systems by managing module responsibilities and dependencies.

name: Design Time
label:LABEL: CodeStructure
description: The stage at which changes to the system are planned and implemented.

name: Responsibilities Redistribution
label:LABEL: DesignPrinciple
description: A tactic that involves reorganizing module responsibilities to improve cohesion and reduce the impact of changes.

name: Microkernel Pattern
label:LABEL: ArchPattern
description: An architectural pattern that separates core functionality from extended functionalities provided by plug-ins.

name: Stateless Server
label:LABEL: DesignPattern
description: A design pattern where the server does not maintain client state, treating each request independently.

name: Component Replacement
label:LABEL: CodeStructure
description: A tactic for modifiability that allows components to be replaced in build scripts or makefiles.

name: SOA (Service-Oriented Architecture)
label:LABEL: ArchPattern
description: An architectural pattern that allows services to communicate over a network, facilitating integration and scalability.

name: Integration Tactics
label:LABEL: DesignPattern
description: Strategies used to facilitate the integration of different systems or components.

name: API Access
label:LABEL: CodeStructure
description: A structured way to interact with external services, such as accessing the Google Play Store.

name: Shopping Cart Feature
label:LABEL: CodeStructure
description: A component commonly integrated into e-commerce systems to manage product selections and transactions.

name: Dynamic Discovery Service
label:LABEL: ArchPattern
description: A service designed to dynamically identify and integrate available services or components.

name: Client-Server Pattern
label:LABEL: ArchPattern
description: An architectural pattern that separates the client and server roles, allowing for distributed computing.

name: Abstract Common Services Tactic
label:LABEL: DesignPrinciple
description: A design principle aimed at reducing coupling in software architecture, potentially at the cost of cohesion.

name: Race Condition
label:LABEL: DesignPrinciple
description: A situation in concurrent programming where the outcome depends on the sequence or timing of uncontrollable events.

name: Locks
label:LABEL: CodeStructure
description: A mechanism used to enforce sequential access to shared state in concurrent programming.

name: Performance Tactics
label:LABEL: QualityAttribute
description: Strategies to enhance system performance by managing resource demand and availability.

name: Service Level Agreement (SLA)
label:LABEL: DesignPattern
description: A formal agreement that specifies the expected performance and response times for system requests.

name: Resource Management
label:LABEL: DesignPattern
description: Techniques to effectively manage and allocate system resources to improve performance.

name: Event Management
label:LABEL: CodeStructure
description: A structure for managing the arrival and processing of events in a system.

name: Bound Execution Times
label:LABEL: DesignPrinciple
description: A tactic that involves placing limits on execution time to manage resource usage and performance.

name: Resource Management Tactics
label:LABEL: DesignPattern
description: A collection of strategies aimed at optimizing resource usage and improving system performance.

name: Error Correction Mode
label:LABEL: CodeStructure
description: A specific operational state of the system that affects how it responds to stimuli, particularly in error handling.

name: Peak Load
label:LABEL: CodeStructure
description: A state of the system where it experiences maximum demand, influencing performance and response behavior.

name: Overload Mode
label:LABEL: CodeStructure
description: A condition where the system is overwhelmed by requests, affecting its ability to respond effectively.

name: User Request
label:LABEL: CodeStructure
description: An external stimulus that triggers the system to process a service request.

name: System Response
label:LABEL: CodeStructure
description: The various ways a system can respond to stimuli, including returning a response, generating an error, or ignoring requests.

name: Stateless Map Instances
label:LABEL: CodeStructure
description: Instances in the map phase that do not maintain state and operate independently, enhancing parallel processing.

name: Key-Value Pairs
label:LABEL: CodeStructure
description: The data format used for communication between map and reduce instances in the map-reduce pattern.

name: Bound Queue Sizes
label:LABEL: QualityAttribute
description: A tactic that controls the maximum number of queued arrivals to manage resource usage effectively.

name: Scheduling Policies
label:LABEL: QualityAttribute
description: Concepts that define how resources are prioritized and dispatched, impacting resource usage and performance.

name: Maintain Multiple Copies of Computations
label:LABEL: QualityAttribute
description: A tactic to enhance performance by keeping multiple copies of computations.

name: Reduce Computational Overhead
label:LABEL: QualityAttribute
description: A tactic aimed at minimizing the resources required for computation to enhance performance.

name: Map-Reduce
label:LABEL: DesignPattern
description: A design pattern for processing large data sets with a distributed algorithm on a cluster, enhancing performance and scalability.

name: Fail Safe
label:LABEL: DesignPattern
description: A design approach that ensures a system can shut down safely to prevent harm.

name: Unsafe State Detection
label:LABEL: DesignPattern
description: A pattern for recognizing and responding to unsafe states in a system.

name: Manual Operation Transition
label:LABEL: DesignPattern
description: A design pattern that allows a system to transition to manual control in case of failure.

name: Safety-Critical Functions
label:LABEL: CodeStructure
description: Functions within a system that are critical for maintaining safety and preventing harm.

name: Rollback Tactic
label:LABEL: QualityAttribute
description: A tactic that allows the system to revert to a previously known good state upon failure detection.

name: Repair State Tactic
label:LABEL: QualityAttribute
description: A tactic that repairs an erroneous state to increase the set of states a component can handle competently.

name: Reconfiguration Tactic
label:LABEL: QualityAttribute
description: A tactic that remaps the logical architecture onto functioning resources to recover from component failures.

name: Degradation Tactic
label:LABEL: QualityAttribute
description: A tactic that allows the system to maintain partial functionality when full functionality is not possible.

name: Performance Patterns
label:LABEL: DesignPattern
description: A catalog of design patterns focused on enhancing performance and scalability in software applications.

name: Safety Tactics
label:LABEL: DesignPattern
description: A set of strategies to ensure system safety by avoiding, detecting, and remediating unsafe states.

name: Unsafe State Avoidance
label:LABEL: DesignPattern
description: A tactic that employs mechanisms to prevent the system from entering unsafe states.

name: Unsafe State Remediation
label:LABEL: DesignPattern
description: A tactic that involves recovering from an unsafe state to ensure safe operation.

name: Backup Sensor
label:LABEL: CodeStructure
description: A component that serves as a fallback to ensure system functionality in case of primary sensor failure.

name: Redundant Sensors
label:LABEL: DesignPattern
description: A pattern that involves replicating sensors to ensure safety by guarding against the failure of any single sensor.

name: Monitor-Actuator
label:LABEL: DesignPattern
description: A pattern that separates the computation of actuator values from their validation, enhancing safety in actuator control.

name: Separated Safety
label:LABEL: DesignPattern
description: A pattern that divides a system into safety-critical and non-safety-critical portions to reduce certification costs.

name: Containment Tactics
label:LABEL: DesignPattern
description: Design patterns that limit the harm associated with unsafe states, including redundancy and barriers.

name: Redundancy Tactics
label:LABEL: DesignPattern
description: Design patterns that ensure system operation continues in case of failures by using backup components.

name: Intercepting Validator
label:LABEL: DesignPattern
description: A design pattern that inserts a wrapper between the source and destination of messages to validate message integrity and detect intrusions.

name: Intrusion Prevention System
label:LABEL: DesignPattern
description: A standalone security component designed to monitor network traffic for malicious activity and prevent attacks.

name: Attack Detection
label:LABEL: CodeStructure
description: A system component responsible for identifying unauthorized access attempts.

name: Response Measures
label:LABEL: QualityAttribute
description: Metrics related to the effectiveness of a system\'s response to security incidents.

name: DoS Attack Prevention Mechanisms
label:LABEL: ArchPattern
description: Architectural strategies employed to mitigate Denial of Service attacks.

name: Audit Tactic
label:LABEL: DesignPattern
description: A design pattern that involves keeping a record of user and system actions to trace and identify attackers.

name: Nonrepudiation Tactic
label:LABEL: DesignPattern
description: A design pattern that ensures that the sender of a message cannot deny having sent it, enhancing accountability.

name: Actor Identification
label:LABEL: QualityAttribute
description: The process of identifying users or systems that interact with the software, crucial for security.

name: Access Limitation
label:LABEL: QualityAttribute
description: Involves restricting access to resources to minimize the attack surface of a system.

name: Demilitarized Zone (DMZ)
label:LABEL: ArchPattern
description: A physical or logical subnetwork that contains and exposes an organization\'s external services to an untrusted network.

name: Dependency Injection Pattern
label:LABEL: DesignPattern
description: A design pattern that separates a client\'s dependencies from its behavior, allowing for inversion of control.

name: Intercepting Filter Pattern
label:LABEL: DesignPattern
description: A design pattern used to inject pre- and post-processing to requests or responses between a client and a service.

name: Static Scheduling
label:LABEL: DesignPattern
description: A scheduling strategy where preemption points and resource assignments are determined offline, reducing runtime overhead.

name: Event Rate Management
label:LABEL: DesignPattern
description: A design tactic that controls the rate of events entering a system to optimize performance.

name: Event Prioritization
label:LABEL: DesignPattern
description: A design tactic that assigns higher priority to certain events, improving system responsiveness for critical tasks.

name: Resource Increase
label:LABEL: DesignPattern
description: A design tactic that involves adding more resources to improve performance, analogous to increasing vehicle speed.

name: Efficiency Increase
label:LABEL: DesignPattern
description: A design tactic that focuses on finding more efficient routes or methods to enhance performance.

name: Computational Overhead Reduction
label:LABEL: DesignPattern
description: A design tactic aimed at minimizing the computational load to improve overall system performance.

name: Cancel Command
label:LABEL: DesignPattern
description: A design pattern that allows users to cancel ongoing operations, enhancing usability by providing feedback and control.

name: Undo Command
label:LABEL: DesignPattern
description: A design pattern that allows users to revert to a previous state, requiring the system to maintain state information for effective operation.

name: Aggregate Command
label:LABEL: DesignPattern
description: A design pattern that allows users to perform repetitive operations on multiple objects efficiently, enhancing usability.

name: User Initiative
label:LABEL: DesignPrinciple
description: A principle describing the user\'s role in initiating actions within a human-computer interaction.

name: System Initiative
label:LABEL: DesignPrinciple
description: A principle describing the system\'s role in initiating actions within a human-computer interaction.

name: Mixed Initiative
label:LABEL: DesignPrinciple
description: A principle that combines user and system initiatives in human-computer interactions.

name: Nondeterminism
label:LABEL: QualityAttribute
description: A characteristic of systems that exhibit unpredictable behavior, complicating testing efforts.

name: Cyclic Dependencies
label:LABEL: CodeStructure
description: A situation where two or more components depend on each other, which can complicate testing and maintenance.

name: Originator
label:LABEL: CodeStructure
description: The component that creates and manages the state that can be saved and restored using the memento pattern.

name: Caretaker
label:LABEL: CodeStructure
description: The component that holds the memento and is responsible for managing the state changes of the originator.

name: Software Interface
label:LABEL: CodeStructure
description: A boundary across which elements meet and interact, controlling access to their internals and facilitating communication.

name: Task Model
label:LABEL: CodeStructure
description: A representation of the tasks that users perform, which can be maintained to enhance usability and user experience.

name: User Model
label:LABEL: CodeStructure
description: A representation of user data and preferences, maintained to improve system responsiveness and personalization.

name: System Model
label:LABEL: CodeStructure
description: A representation of the system\'s architecture and components, maintained to support usability and system integrity.

name: Access Rights
label:LABEL: QualityAttribute
description: Refers to the security aspect of interfaces, determining what actions actors can perform.

name: Resource Semantics
label:LABEL: CodeStructure
description: Defines the meaning and effects of invoking a resource, including state changes and error handling.

name: Operations, Events, and Properties
label:LABEL: CodeStructure
description: Components of interfaces that define how data and control are transferred and managed.

name: Error Handling
label:LABEL: QualityAttribute
description: The practice of anticipating, detecting, and responding to errors in a software system to ensure robustness.

name: Interface Evolution
label:LABEL: DesignPattern
description: Describes the techniques for evolving software interfaces while maintaining compatibility.

name: Deprecation
label:LABEL: DesignPrinciple
description: A technique for removing an interface while providing notice to its users.

name: Versioning
label:LABEL: DesignPrinciple
description: A technique that allows multiple versions of an interface to coexist, facilitating software evolution.

name: Extension
label:LABEL: DesignPattern
description: A technique for adding new resources to an interface without altering the original interface.

name: Internal Interface
label:LABEL: CodeStructure
description: An interface used internally within an element to manage interactions with external interfaces.

name: External Interface
label:LABEL: CodeStructure
description: An interface exposed to actors that allows interaction with an element.

name: Load-Balancing Algorithm
label:LABEL: ArchPattern
description: An architectural decision that affects the routing of messages and distribution of workloads across servers.

name: Scheduling Algorithm
label:LABEL: ArchPattern
description: An algorithm that determines the order in which tasks are processed, impacting system performance.

name: Topology
label:LABEL: ArchPattern
description: The arrangement of different elements in a system, which can influence performance and scalability.

name: Principle of Least Surprise
label:LABEL: DesignPrinciple
description: Interfaces should behave consistently with the actor’s expectations to minimize confusion.

name: Small Interfaces Principle
label:LABEL: DesignPrinciple
description: Elements should exchange as little information as possible to enhance clarity and reduce complexity.

name: Don’t Repeat Yourself Principle
label:LABEL: DesignPrinciple
description: Interfaces should provide composable primitives to avoid redundancy and promote consistency.

name: Interface Scope
label:LABEL: CodeStructure
description: Defines the collection of resources directly available to the actors, impacting security and performance.

name: JSON
label:LABEL: CodeStructure
description: A lightweight data interchange format that uses nested name/value pairs, making it efficient for serialization and deserialization.

name: Stateless Interactions
label:LABEL: DesignPrinciple
description: A design principle where each client-server interaction is independent, and the server does not retain client state.

name: Cacheable Resources
label:LABEL: QualityAttribute
description: A quality attribute that allows resources to be stored temporarily to improve performance and reduce latency.

name: Tiered System Architecture
label:LABEL: ArchPattern
description: An architectural style that separates different concerns into independent layers, allowing for independent deployment.

name: Code on Demand
label:LABEL: DesignPattern
description: A design pattern where the server can send executable code to the client, enhancing flexibility.

name: Hypervisor
label:LABEL: ArchPattern
description: A software layer that enables virtualization by managing virtual machines and their resources.

name: Virtual Memory
label:LABEL: ArchPattern
description: A memory management technique that allows the execution of processes that may not be completely in memory, enhancing system performance and isolation.

name: Status Indicator
label:LABEL: DesignPattern
description: A design pattern that uses predefined codes to indicate the success or failure of operations, enhancing error detection.

name: Error Logging
label:LABEL: CodeStructure
description: A code structure that captures and stores error information for later analysis, aiding in debugging and system reliability.

name: State Management
label:LABEL: DDDConcept
description: An architectural pattern that focuses on managing the state of distributed transactions, emphasizing responsiveness and eventual consistency.

name: Idempotent Operations

name: Error Recovery Strategy

name: Container Image

name: Version Control
label:LABEL: QualityAttribute

name: VM (Virtual Machine)

name: Specification File

name: Test Infrastructure
label:LABEL: CodeStructure

name: Performance Efficiency
label:LABEL: QualityAttribute

name: Stateless Architecture

label:LABEL: DesignPattern

name: Global Load Balancing

name: Fault Detection
label:LABEL: QualityAttribute

name: Timestamping

name: Energy Management
label:LABEL: QualityAttribute

name: Cloud Computing

name: Distributed Computing

name: Autoscaler

name: Container Scaling
label:LABEL: ArchPattern

name: Service Instance
label:LABEL: CodeStructure

name: Long Tail Distribution
label:LABEL: QualityAttribute

name: Apache Zookeeper
label:LABEL: CodeStructure

name: Autoscaling
label:LABEL: QualityAttribute

name: Routine Changes

name: Performance Scenario
label:LABEL: QualityAttribute

name: User Roles

name: Network Properties

name: Security Tactic

name: Security Framework

label:LABEL: ArchPattern

name: C&C views

name: Technical Debt Assessment

name: Connascence of Execution

name: Connascence of Timing

name: Connascence of Values

name: Connascence of Identity

name: Locality of Connascence

name: Recoverability

name: Connected Components

name: Cohesive Code

label:LABEL: DesignPrinciple

name: Agility

name: Auditability

name: Integration Architecture

name: Architecture Quantum

name: fitness functions

name: architecture quantum

name: Component A

name: Component A2

name: Coupling Level
label:LABEL: DesignPrinciple
description: A measure of the dependencies between components, which should be minimized for better maintainability.

label:LABEL: ArchPattern
description: Architecture pattern where each data domain is served by its own database server, promoting independence and scalability.

name: Ease of Learning Curve

description: Quality attribute that measures how easily new users can learn and adopt a technology or system.

name: Ease of Data Modeling
label:LABEL: QualityAttribute
description: Quality attribute that assesses how easily data can be represented and modified in a data model.

name: Shared Functionality

description: Common code or features that can be utilized across multiple components or services to avoid redundancy.

name: Customer Domain

name: Customer Profile Component

name: Data Integrator

name: Data Disintegrator

name: Database Decomposition

name: Service C
label:LABEL: CodeStructure

name: Granularity Disintegrators
label:LABEL: DesignPrinciple

label:LABEL: DesignPrinciple

name: Granularity Disintegrator
label:LABEL: DesignPattern
description: A concept related to breaking down services into smaller, more manageable units based on cohesion and change metrics.

name: Granularity Disintegration

name: Transactional Saga Pattern

name: Datomic

name: Transactional Saga Patterns
label:LABEL: DesignPattern
description: A design pattern that manages complex transactions across multiple services to ensure data consistency and integrity.

name: Shared Service

label:LABEL: DesignPrinciple

label:LABEL: DesignPrinciple

name: structural design patterns

name: Collaboration
label:LABEL: DesignPattern
description: A design pattern that describes how objects interact and collaborate to achieve a common goal.

name: Business Logic Tier
label:LABEL: CodeStructure
description: The layer that contains the core functionality and processing logic of the application.

name: Data Source Tier
label:LABEL: CodeStructure
description: The layer responsible for data persistence and retrieval, interacting with databases or other data stores.

name: Interaction Overview Diagram
label:LABEL: DesignPattern
description: A high-level abstraction diagram that provides an overview of interactions, summarizing the flow of control among various interaction diagrams.

name: Object-Oriented Programming Languages
label:LABEL: CodeStructure
description: Languages designed to support object-oriented programming concepts such as classes and objects.

name: Dependency Relationship
label:LABEL: CodeStructure
description: A relationship where one configuration item (CI) depends on another, indicating mutual dependency which is crucial for understanding interactions in software design.

name: Configuration
label:LABEL: DesignPrinciple
description: A model representing the state of the product configuration process, encapsulating the selected parts.

name: Analysis
label:LABEL: DesignPrinciple
description: The principle that facilitates the analysis of architecture design, including performance and behavior considerations.

name: Functional Requirement
label:LABEL: QualityAttribute
description: Specifies the functionality that the software system must provide.

name: Nonfunctional Requirement
label:LABEL: QualityAttribute
description: Specifies the quality attributes, constraints, and behaviors of the software system.

name: Box-and-Line Diagram
label:LABEL: DesignPattern
description: A conceptual model used to represent the architecture of a system, illustrating elements and their relationships.

name: Software Requirement Specification (SRS)
label:LABEL: CodeStructure
description: A document that describes the intended purpose and environment for software under development.

name: Controller Class
label:LABEL: CodeStructure
description: A class that manages the flow of the application and coordinates activities among other classes, typically associated with specific use cases.

name: Entity Class
label:LABEL: DDDConcept
description: Represents the information stored and exchanged among elements of the system, encapsulating the domain data.

name: Boundary Class
label:LABEL: CodeStructure
description: Acts as an interface between the system and the outside world, often represented by UI components.

name: Analysis Class Diagram
label:LABEL: CodeStructure
description: A diagram that describes key classes and their interrelationships in a system, focusing on abstractions and functionalities.

name: AmericanTaxPayer
label:LABEL: CodeStructure
description: An interface defining the operation ReportTax() that must be implemented by classes like AmericanLawyer and AmericanProfessor.

name: AmericanCitizenTaxHandler
label:LABEL: CodeStructure
description: A class responsible for processing the ReportTax() operation, providing a centralized implementation for tax reporting.

name: AmericanLawyer
label:LABEL: DDDConcept
description: A class representing a specific type of taxpayer that implements the AmericanTaxPayer interface.

name: AmericanProfessor
label:LABEL: DDDConcept
description: A class representing another type of taxpayer that implements the AmericanTaxPayer interface.

name: Order Processing System (OPS)
label:LABEL: DDDConcept
description: A system designed for managing online orders, requiring OO analysis and design.

name: OO Analysis
label:LABEL: CodeStructure
description: The initial stage of object-oriented development focused on understanding domain requirements.

name: OO Design
label:LABEL: CodeStructure
description: The stage where responsibilities and attributes of classes are defined based on the analysis.

name: Public Interface
label:LABEL: CodeStructure
description: Defines the operations and attributes that a class exposes to the outside world, ensuring stability and completeness.

name: Constructor Operation
label:LABEL: DesignPattern
description: A method used to initialize an object\'s data members upon creation, often part of the Factory pattern.

name: Destructor Operation
label:LABEL: DesignPattern
description: A method that cleans up resources when an object is no longer in use, important for resource management.

name: Accessor Operation
label:LABEL: DesignPattern
description: A method that retrieves information from an object without modifying its state, promoting encapsulation.

name: Mutator Operation
label:LABEL: DesignPattern
description: A method that modifies the state of an object, often leading to state transitions.

name: Professor Class
label:LABEL: CodeStructure
description: A class that initially handles multiple responsibilities, leading to a lack of cohesion.

name: Advisor Class
label:LABEL: CodeStructure
description: A subclass of Professor that handles responsibilities related to advising students.

name: Instructor Class
label:LABEL: CodeStructure
description: A subclass of Professor that handles responsibilities related to course instruction.

name: Advisor Interface
label:LABEL: CodeStructure
description: An interface that declares operations for the Advisor class.

name: Instructor Interface
label:LABEL: CodeStructure
description: An interface that declares operations for the Instructor class.

name: Abstraction via Inheritance and Polymorphism
label:LABEL: DesignPattern
description: A design approach that allows for extending functionality without modifying existing code.

name: Data Flow Architecture
label:LABEL: ArchPattern
description: An architectural style that views the software system as a series of transformations on data, emphasizing the independence of data and operations.

name: Batch Sequential Architecture
label:LABEL: ArchPattern
description: A software architecture pattern where data is processed in batches sequentially, with each subsystem functioning independently.

name: Data Processing Element
label:LABEL: CodeStructure
description: A component in data flow architecture that transforms input data into output data.

name: Pipe and Filter Architecture
label:LABEL: ArchPattern
description: An architectural pattern that decomposes a system into components that process data streams, allowing for concurrent execution.

name: Static Methods
label:LABEL: CodeStructure
description: Methods that belong to a class rather than an instance, used in the batch sequential architecture example.

name: Data Stream
label:LABEL: CodeStructure
description: A mechanism for transmitting data between components in the Pipe and Filter architecture, functioning as a first-in/first-out buffer.

name: Active Filter
label:LABEL: DesignPattern
description: A filter in the Pipe and Filter architecture that pulls data from an upstream source and pushes transformed data downstream.

name: MVC Controller
label:LABEL: ArchPattern
description: Manages application flow by handling events and coordinating between views and models.

name: RegistrationController
label:LABEL: CodeStructure
description: A specific controller class responsible for handling registration-related web page events.

name: SessionController
label:LABEL: CodeStructure
description: A controller class that manages user sessions and interacts with customer information.

name: CustomerInformation
label:LABEL: CodeStructure
description: A class that holds customer data and is used by controllers for processing.

name: CustomerInfoDB
label:LABEL: CodeStructure
description: Database interface class that provides operations for accessing customer information.

name: Class-Responsibility-Collaborator (CRC) Card
label:LABEL: DesignPattern
description: A technique used to identify classes and their responsibilities in object-oriented design.

name: High-Level Design
label:LABEL: ArchPattern
description: Specifies the interaction of a system\'s major components and their environment.

name: Low-Level Design
label:LABEL: ArchPattern
description: The stage of design where attributes and operations are assigned to classes based on interaction diagrams.

name: Aggregation
label:LABEL: DDDConcept
description: A relationship where one class is a collection or container of other classes, but the contained classes can exist independently.

name: CRC Card Method
label:LABEL: DesignPattern
description: A collaborative design technique used to identify the responsibilities and collaborators of classes.

name: Data-Centered Architecture
label:LABEL: ArchPattern
description: An architectural style that emphasizes the flow of data and events, often used in knowledge-based systems.

name: Student Class
label:LABEL: CodeStructure
description: Represents a class definition in object-oriented programming, encapsulating student attributes and behaviors.
source: Systems Analysis and Design in - John W. Satzinger, Robert B. Ja.pdf

name: Serializable Interface
label:LABEL: CodeStructure
description: An interface implemented by the Student class to allow its instances to be serialized for storage or transmission.

name: Bidirectional Data Link
label:LABEL: QualityAttribute
description: A characteristic of the architecture that allows for two-way data communication between components.

name: Control Flow Links
label:LABEL: QualityAttribute
description: Links that manage the control over data and agents within the architecture, affecting the logic flow.

name: Blackboard Architecture
label:LABEL: ArchPattern
description: An architectural pattern that facilitates collaboration among independent knowledge sources to solve complex problems using a shared data store.

name: Knowledge Source
label:LABEL: DDDConcept
description: An entity that represents a specific area of expertise contributing to the problem-solving process within the blackboard architecture.

name: Rule-Based Strategy
label:LABEL: DesignPattern
description: A design pattern that utilizes rules to trigger actions in knowledge sources based on changes in the blackboard.

name: Controller Subsystem
label:LABEL: CodeStructure
description: The component responsible for initiating the blackboard and knowledge sources, and periodically inspecting the state of the blackboard.

name: Activation Mechanism
label:LABEL: DesignPattern
description: A design pattern that allows knowledge sources to be triggered based on changes in the blackboard, facilitating dynamic problem-solving.

name: Data-Centered Repository Architecture
label:LABEL: ArchPattern
description: An architecture where a data repository controls the logic flow, often used in layered and client-server architectures.

name: Agent
label:LABEL: DDDConcept
description: An entity in the real estate domain that represents a real estate agent, encapsulating their attributes and behaviors.
source: Systems Analysis and Design in - John W. Satzinger, Robert B. Ja.pdf

name: Virtual Machine
label:LABEL: ArchPattern
description: An architectural pattern that provides a virtual abstraction layer, allowing applications to run independently of the underlying hardware.

name: Java Virtual Machine (JVM)
label:LABEL: ArchPattern
description: A specific implementation of a virtual machine that enables Java programs to be platform-independent by interpreting bytecode.

name: Common Language Runtime (CLR)
label:LABEL: ArchPattern
description: The virtual machine component of the .NET framework that manages the execution of .NET programs and provides services such as garbage collection.

name: Interpreter Execution Engine
label:LABEL: ArchPattern
description: An architectural pattern that simulates CPU operations for executing bytecode in a virtual machine.

name: Hierarchical Architecture
label:LABEL: ArchPattern
description: An architectural style that organizes a software system into a hierarchy of modules, where lower-level modules provide services to upper-level modules.

name: Simulation
label:LABEL: DDDConcept
description: The use of models to conduct experiments and analyze system behavior, particularly in software engineering.

name: Method Invocation
label:LABEL: CodeStructure
description: A mechanism for components to interact by calling methods defined in their interfaces.

name: Master-Slave Architecture
label:LABEL: ArchPattern
description: A variant of the main-subroutine architecture style that supports fault tolerance and system reliability.

name: Main-Subroutine Architecture
label:LABEL: ArchPattern
description: An architectural style that organizes software into a hierarchy of modules with a main control module and subordinate subroutines.

name: Transaction Flow
label:LABEL: DDDConcept
description: A flow that evaluates incoming data and decides on action paths, relevant in the context of domain-driven design.

name: Transform Flow
label:LABEL: DDDConcept
description: A flow that processes incoming data and transforms it, often isolated from other flows.

name: Transaction Center
label:LABEL: CodeStructure
description: A control module that manages transaction flows and action paths in a software architecture.

name: Action Module
label:LABEL: CodeStructure
description: Modules that represent specific actions in the transaction flow, responsible for processing tasks.

name: System Reliability
label:LABEL: QualityAttribute
description: A quality attribute that measures the ability of a system to perform its intended function consistently over time.

name: I/O Services
label:LABEL: QualityAttribute
description: Services that handle input and output operations, crucial for system functionality.

name: Business Logic
label:LABEL: CodeStructure
description: The part of the application that encodes the real-world business rules and processes.

name: Processing Layer
label:LABEL: CodeStructure
description: The layer that handles business logic and processes requests from the user interface layer.

name: Presentation-Abstraction-Control (PAC)
label:LABEL: ArchPattern
description: An architectural pattern that decomposes a system into a hierarchy of cooperating agents, each with Presentation, Abstraction, and Control components.

name: Presentation Component
label:LABEL: CodeStructure
description: Responsible for data input and output in GUI interfaces, interacting with the Abstraction component.

name: Abstraction Component
label:LABEL: CodeStructure
description: Provides logical data concepts and services, encapsulating detailed data manipulation.

name: Control Component
label:LABEL: CodeStructure
description: Mediates communication between the Presentation and Abstraction components within an agent and with other agents.

name: MVC-I
label:LABEL: ArchPattern
description: An architectural pattern that combines the Model, View, and Controller into a single structure for simple GUI applications.

name: MVC-II
label:LABEL: ArchPattern
description: An enhanced version of MVC-I where the View and Controller are separated, allowing for better modularity and division of labor.

name: ViewController
label:LABEL: CodeStructure
description: Acts as a mediator between the Model and the View, handling user input and updating the View based on Model changes.

name: Point-to-Point Messaging
label:LABEL: ArchPattern
description: A messaging architecture where messages are sent from a producer to a specific consumer via a message queue.

name: Reliable Message Delivery
label:LABEL: QualityAttribute
description: A quality attribute ensuring that messages are delivered exactly once, enhancing the reliability of messaging systems.

name: Message-Driven Architecture
label:LABEL: ArchPattern
description: An architectural style that uses messages to communicate between components, allowing for loose coupling.

name: Event Target
label:LABEL: CodeStructure
description: A component that listens for and responds to events in an event-driven architecture.

name: EventListener
label:LABEL: CodeStructure
description: An interface for handling events in Java, serving as a base for user-defined event listeners.

name: MyListener
label:LABEL: CodeStructure
description: A user-defined event listener interface that extends EventListener, allowing custom event handling.

name: MyEventObject
label:LABEL: CodeStructure
description: A user-defined event object that extends EventObject, encapsulating additional data such as system time.

name: Sink
label:LABEL: CodeStructure
description: A class implementing MyListener to handle events and perform actions based on event data.

name: Source
label:LABEL: CodeStructure
description: An event source class that triggers events and manages listener registration, allowing for concurrent event handling.

name: Message Topic
label:LABEL: ArchPattern
description: An architectural pattern used for publishing messages to multiple subscribers in a messaging system.

name: Message Producer
label:LABEL: CodeStructure
description: A component responsible for creating and sending messages to a message destination.

name: Entity EJB
label:LABEL: DDDConcept
description: A type of Enterprise Java Bean that represents a persistent object in the domain model.

name: Session EJB
label:LABEL: DDDConcept
description: A type of Enterprise Java Bean that encapsulates business logic and manages client interactions.

name: Virtual Repository
label:LABEL: ArchPattern
description: An architectural variant that provides a unified view of multiple physical repositories without existing physically.

name: Distributed Repository
label:LABEL: ArchPattern
description: An architecture where data is distributed across multiple sites, enhancing scalability and availability.

name: Security Management
label:LABEL: QualityAttribute
description: An attribute that ensures proper authority privileges and data manipulation controls for different users or groups.

name: PipedReader
label:LABEL: CodeStructure
description: A Java class that allows reading data from a pipe, enabling data consumption in the Pipe and Filter architecture.

name: Apache Struts
label:LABEL: DesignPattern
description: A well-known framework that implements the MVC architectural pattern for web application design.

name: PAC Architecture
label:LABEL: ArchPattern
description: A hierarchical software architecture pattern that organizes components into a structure of interacting agents.

name: XML Namespace
label:LABEL: CodeStructure
description: A mechanism to avoid name clashes in XML documents, similar to .NET namespaces or Java packages.

name: WSDL Document
label:LABEL: CodeStructure
description: An interface document that describes the operations and messages of a web service.

name: Port Type
label:LABEL: DDDConcept
description: A collection of related operations defined in a WSDL document for a web service.

name: Operation
label:LABEL: DDDConcept
description: An action defined in a WSDL document that represents a specific functionality of a web service.

name: Object Request Broker (ORB)
label:LABEL: CodeStructure
description: Middleware that facilitates communication between clients and servers in a distributed environment.

name: Interface Definition Language (IDL)
label:LABEL: CodeStructure
description: Language used to define interfaces for CORBA objects, enabling platform-independent communication.

name: Dynamic Invocation Interface (DII)
label:LABEL: DesignPattern
description: Allows clients to invoke methods on CORBA objects without prior knowledge of their interfaces.

name: Dynamic Skeleton Interface (DSI)
label:LABEL: DesignPattern
description: Used by ORB to handle requests to objects without compile-time knowledge of their implementation.

name: Low Fault-Tolerance
label:LABEL: QualityAttribute
description: A quality attribute indicating the system\'s inability to handle failures gracefully.

name: Two-Tier Client-Server Architecture
label:LABEL: ArchPattern
description: An architectural pattern that separates the user interface from the business logic and database management.

name: Separation of Responsibilities
label:LABEL: DesignPrinciple
description: A design principle that emphasizes the division of concerns in software architecture, enhancing maintainability and scalability.

name: Remote Procedure Call (RPC)
label:LABEL: ArchPattern
description: A protocol that allows a program to execute a procedure on a remote server as if it were a local method call.

name: Message-Oriented Protocols
label:LABEL: CodeStructure
description: Protocols that facilitate communication between services in a service-oriented architecture.

name: Broker Architecture
label:LABEL: ArchPattern
description: An architectural style that uses a broker to mediate communication between clients and services, facilitating loose coupling.

name: Grid Service Architecture
label:LABEL: ArchPattern
description: An architecture that manages distributed resources across networks, providing both computational and data services.

name: Component-Based Architecture
label:LABEL: ArchPattern
description: An architectural pattern that emphasizes the design of software systems as a collection of reusable components.

name: Interface Port
label:LABEL: CodeStructure
description: A defined point of interaction for components, specifying the services provided and required by the component.

name: Provided Port
label:LABEL: CodeStructure
description: Represents the services that a component provides to other components, facilitating interaction.

name: Required Port
label:LABEL: CodeStructure
description: Represents the services that a component requires from other components, enabling dependency management.

name: Counter Interface
label:LABEL: CodeStructure
description: An interface defining methods for a counter component, illustrating the use of interfaces in component-oriented design.

name: CounterImpl1
label:LABEL: CodeStructure
description: A concrete implementation of the Counter interface, demonstrating the implementation of an interface in Java.

name: Message-Driven Interaction
label:LABEL: CodeStructure
description: A communication pattern where components exchange messages, often used in distributed systems.

name: Architecture Trade-off Analysis Method (ATAM)
label:LABEL: DesignPattern
description: A systematic evaluation approach for analyzing architectural trade-offs in software design.

name: Active Reviews for Intermediate Designs (ARID)
label:LABEL: DesignPattern
description: A review method for assessing intermediate software architecture designs.

name: Presentation/View
label:LABEL: CodeStructure
description: The user interface layer in both PAC and MVC architectures, responsible for displaying data to the user.

name: Abstraction/Model
label:LABEL: CodeStructure
description: The data layer in PAC and MVC architectures, representing the application\'s data and business logic.

name: Task Dispatcher
label:LABEL: CodeStructure
description: A component responsible for distributing tasks to various processing units, enhancing parallelism and performance.

name: Just-in-Time (JIT) Manufacture
label:LABEL: ArchPattern
description: An architectural approach that minimizes inventory costs by ordering parts only as needed, enhancing manufacturing efficiency.

name: Online Computer Vendor System (OCVS)
label:LABEL: CodeStructure
description: The system designed for an online computer vendor to manage orders and inventory efficiently.

name: Object-Oriented Architecture
label:LABEL: ArchPattern
description: An architectural style that structures software around objects, which encapsulate data and behavior.

name: UML Component Diagrams
label:LABEL: CodeStructure
description: A type of diagram used to visualize the components of a system and their relationships.

name: Dynamic UML Diagrams
label:LABEL: CodeStructure
description: Diagrams that describe the dynamic behavior of a system, particularly how components interact over time.

name: Remote Method Invocation (RMI)
label:LABEL: ArchPattern
description: A Java-specific implementation of RPC that allows invoking methods on an object located in another Java Virtual Machine.

name: Client Proxy (Stub)
label:LABEL: CodeStructure
description: A client-side proxy that mediates between the client and the broker, providing transparency and handling communication.

name: Server Proxy (Skeleton)
label:LABEL: CodeStructure
description: A server-side proxy that encapsulates networking functions and mediates between the server and the broker.

name: Java Bean
label:LABEL: CodeStructure
description: A reusable software component that follows the JavaBeans conventions, used here as the Model in the MVC architecture.

name: JSP Page
label:LABEL: CodeStructure
description: JavaServer Pages used as the View component in the MVC architecture to render dynamic content.

name: Controller Servlet
label:LABEL: CodeStructure
description: The component that handles user input and interacts with the Model and View in the MVC architecture.

name: Product Configuration Component
label:LABEL: CodeStructure
description: A modular component responsible for managing the product configuration process.

name: Inventory Management Controller
label:LABEL: CodeStructure
description: A module responsible for managing inventory-related operations within the system.

name: Satellite Computer
label:LABEL: CodeStructure
description: A component that interacts with workers and displays job details, developed using the MVC architecture.

name: Manufacture and Shipping Component
label:LABEL: CodeStructure
description: A subsystem that manages the information flow for the manufacturing process.

name: Conveyor Belt
label:LABEL: CodeStructure
description: A major component of the assembly line that facilitates the movement of materials.

name: Stage Computer
label:LABEL: CodeStructure
description: A computer at each workstation that displays job details and allows communication with the central controller.

name: Component Types
label:LABEL: CodeStructure
description: Different types of UI components such as textual elements, icons, and buttons that form the building blocks of a user interface.

name: Look and Feel
label:LABEL: DesignPrinciple
description: A principle that summarizes the visual aesthetics and usability of the user interface, impacting user perception and interaction.

name: Semantics of User Interface
label:LABEL: DesignPrinciple
description: The meaning and functionality associated with UI components, guiding user interactions and expectations.

name: Dynamic User Interface
label:LABEL: DesignPattern
description: A user interface that adapts to user interactions and preferences, enhancing usability.

name: 1D Layout
label:LABEL: DesignPattern
description: A user interface layout pattern that features a single menu bar for fundamental editing functions.

name: 2D Layout
label:LABEL: DesignPattern
description: A user interface layout pattern that includes a menu system along the x-direction and additional panels along the y-direction.

name: 3D Layout
label:LABEL: DesignPattern
description: A user interface layout pattern that incorporates a menu along the x-direction, toolbars along the y-direction, and tabs along the z-direction.

name: 4D Layout
label:LABEL: DesignPattern
description: A user interface layout pattern that extends the 3D layout by adding more interactive elements, such as depth in the user interface.

name: Command Language Processor
label:LABEL: DesignPattern
description: A pattern for processing user commands in a command-line interface, facilitating interaction with software functionalities.

name: User Interface Components
label:LABEL: CodeStructure
description: The structural elements of a user interface, including buttons, labels, and input fields, that facilitate user interaction.

name: Command Listing
label:LABEL: CodeStructure
description: A structured representation of available commands in a command-line interface, aiding user navigation and command execution.

name: Customizable User Interface
label:LABEL: DesignPattern
description: A design pattern that allows users to modify the interface to suit their preferences, enhancing usability for different user types.

name: Plug-in Module
label:LABEL: CodeStructure
description: A module that can be added to a software application to extend its functionality without altering the core system.

name: Publisher-Subscriber Pattern
label:LABEL: DesignPattern
description: A design pattern where a publisher sends messages to multiple subscribers without knowing their identities, promoting loose coupling.

name: Message Queue Architecture
label:LABEL: ArchPattern
description: An architectural style that uses a queue to facilitate communication between message senders and receivers in a point-to-point manner.

name: Message Topic Architecture
label:LABEL: ArchPattern
description: An architectural style that allows multiple subscribers to receive messages from a single publisher, supporting a one-to-many communication model.

name: Nonbuffered Event-Based Implicit Invocation
label:LABEL: ArchPattern
description: An architectural approach where events are directly invoked without buffering, connecting event sources and listeners.

name: JavaBean Components
label:LABEL: CodeStructure
description: Reusable software components in Java that follow the JavaBeans conventions, allowing for implicit invocation.

name: ActiveX Components
label:LABEL: CodeStructure
description: Software components that enable interactive content in web applications, supporting implicit invocation.

name: Enterprise JavaBean (EJB)
label:LABEL: CodeStructure
description: A server-side software component that encapsulates business logic in Java EE applications, supporting callback mechanisms.

name: Component-oriented Architecture
label:LABEL: ArchPattern
description: An architectural pattern that emphasizes the use of modular components that can be easily modified and replaced.

name: Modular User Interface
label:LABEL: CodeStructure
description: A code structure that allows for the user interface to be composed of interchangeable modules.

name: Eclipse Modeling Framework (EMF)
label:LABEL: ArchPattern
description: An architectural framework that integrates Java, XML, and UML technologies for building customizable software tools.

name: Clipboard Commands
label:LABEL: DesignPattern
description: A design pattern that facilitates data interchange between applications using common commands like Cut, Copy, and Paste.

name: Integration
label:LABEL: QualityAttribute
description: A quality attribute that ensures different software components or systems work together seamlessly.

name: MVC Model
label:LABEL: ArchPattern
description: Architectural pattern that separates the user interface from the business logic, enhancing maintainability and reusability.

name: ActionListener
label:LABEL: DesignPattern
description: A behavioral design pattern that allows objects to be notified of events, facilitating event-driven programming.

name: Direct Manipulation Interface
label:LABEL: DesignPattern
description: A user interface design pattern that allows users to interact with objects directly, providing immediate feedback.

name: JFrame
label:LABEL: CodeStructure
description: A top-level container used in Java Swing applications to create a window.

name: JT extField
label:LABEL: CodeStructure
description: A text field component in Java Swing used for user input and display.

name: Form-based Interface
label:LABEL: DesignPattern
description: A user interface design pattern that presents users with forms to collect input, commonly used in web applications.

name: MVC
label:LABEL: ArchPattern
description: Model-View-Controller architectural pattern separates the application logic from the user interface.

name: Information Representation
label:LABEL: DesignPattern
description: Design pattern for representing data in various formats to enhance user understanding.

name: Product Line Architecture
label:LABEL: ArchPattern
description: A framework that standardizes and maximizes the reuse potential of software artifacts across systems within a specific domain.

name: Reusable Componentbase
label:LABEL: CodeStructure
description: Specifies common functionality across families of systems with direct control of variability.

name: Design-for-commonality
label:LABEL: DesignPrinciple
description: An architectural approach that standardizes assets to build products by encapsulating common features.

name: Design-for-variability
label:LABEL: DesignPrinciple
description: A principle that anticipates variation without compromising commonality, allowing for plug-in compatibility via standard interfaces.

name: Component-based Development
label:LABEL: ArchPattern
description: An approach that emphasizes the use of reusable components to achieve systematic reuse in software development.

name: Component-Oriented Architecture
label:LABEL: ArchPattern
description: An architectural style that emphasizes the use of reusable components to build software systems, particularly in user interfaces.

name: Java UI Components
label:LABEL: CodeStructure
description: A set of classes and interfaces in Java that provide the building blocks for creating graphical user interfaces.

name: Layout Managers
label:LABEL: DesignPattern
description: Design patterns used in graphical user interfaces to arrange components according to specific layout rules.

name: Listener Pattern
label:LABEL: DesignPattern
description: A behavioral design pattern that allows an object to notify other objects about changes in its state, commonly used in event-driven programming.

name: Event Handler
label:LABEL: CodeStructure
description: A function or method that is called in response to an event, linking user actions to the internal logic of the software.

name: User Interface Integration
label:LABEL: ArchPattern
description: An architectural consideration that focuses on how independent extensions can contribute to a cohesive user interface.

name: Design-for-Reuse
label:LABEL: DesignPrinciple
description: Principle focused on creating reusable assets in software development.

name: Design-with-Reuse
label:LABEL: DesignPrinciple
description: Principle that emphasizes creating individual products from reusable assets.

name: Capability Maturity Model for Software (Sw-CMM)
label:LABEL: DDDConcept
description: A process model that assesses the maturity of software processes in an organization.

name: Personal Software Process (PSP)
label:LABEL: DDDConcept
description: A structured software development process that focuses on individual developer performance.

name: Team Software Process (TSP)
label:LABEL: DDDConcept
description: A process model that focuses on team performance and project management in software development.

name: GridLayout
label:LABEL: DesignPattern
description: A layout manager that arranges components in a grid with equal sizes.

name: GridBagLayout
label:LABEL: DesignPattern
description: A flexible layout manager that allows components to span multiple cells in a grid.

name: AbsoluteLayout
label:LABEL: DesignPattern
description: A layout manager that allows absolute positioning of components, useful for prototyping.

name: NullLayout
label:LABEL: DesignPattern
description: A layout manager that does not manage component positions, also useful for prototyping.

name: JComponent
label:LABEL: CodeStructure
description: Base class for all Swing components used in building graphical user interfaces.

name: JPanel
label:LABEL: CodeStructure
description: A generic container that can hold components and is used for organizing UI elements.

name: JButton
label:LABEL: CodeStructure
description: A button component that triggers an action event when clicked.

name: JComboBox
label:LABEL: CodeStructure
description: A component that allows users to select an item from a dropdown list.

name: JTable
label:LABEL: CodeStructure
description: A component that displays data in a tabular format.

name: Control-of-variability
label:LABEL: DesignPrinciple
description: A principle that provides flexibility in assets to meet varying product requirements without compromising commonality.
