name: Compensatory Techniques
label:LABEL: DesignPattern
description: Techniques that allow trade-offs among multiple criteria in decision-making processes.

name: Non-Compensatory Techniques
label:LABEL: DesignPattern
description: Techniques that treat each criterion as a separate entity without allowing trade-offs.

name: DRY principle
label:LABEL: DesignPrinciple
description: A design principle aimed at reducing the repetition of software patterns, replacing it with abstractions or using data normalization.

name: KISS principle
label:LABEL: DesignPrinciple
description: A design principle that states that systems work best if they are kept simple rather than made complex.

name: YAGNI principle
label:LABEL: DesignPrinciple
description: A principle of extreme programming that states that a programmer should not add functionality until it is necessary.

name: Iterative Methods
label:LABEL: DesignPattern
description: A programming approach that uses loops to repeat a block of code, generally more efficient than recursion for CPU performance.

name: Recursive Methods
label:LABEL: DesignPattern
description: A programming approach where a function calls itself to solve a problem, useful for problems like tree operations.

name: Pipeline Processing
label:LABEL: DesignPattern
description: A design pattern that improves performance by processing multiple instructions simultaneously in stages.

name: Memory Unit
label:LABEL: CodeStructure
description: A code structure that represents the storage component of a computer system, including various types of memory.

name: Input/Output Devices
label:LABEL: CodeStructure
description: A code structure that encompasses devices that provide input to and output from the computer system.

name: Basic Data Types
label:LABEL: CodeStructure
description: Primitive data types that serve as the building blocks for data structures, including integers, floats, and booleans.

name: Composite Data Types
label:LABEL: CodeStructure
description: Data types that are composed of multiple basic or compound data types, allowing for more complex data representation.

name: Parallel Programming
label:LABEL: CodeStructure
description: A type of computing where different parts of a program are executed simultaneously to achieve the same objective.

name: Device Management
label:LABEL: CodeStructure
description: Part of an operating system that manages device communication and control.

name: Information Management
label:LABEL: CodeStructure
description: Component of an operating system that manages data storage and retrieval.

name: Decapsulation
label:LABEL: CodeStructure
description: The process of accessing the internal state of an encapsulated object, often used in the context of network protocols.

name: OSI Model
label:LABEL: ArchPattern
description: A conceptual framework used to understand and implement networking protocols in a layered manner.

name: Protocol
label:LABEL: CodeStructure
description: Set of rules used by a layer to exchange information with a peer entity, essential for communication in layered architectures.

name: Second Normal Form (2 NF)
label:LABEL: CodeStructure
description: A database normalization form that removes partial dependencies, ensuring that all non-key attributes are fully functional dependent on the primary key.

name: Third Normal Form (3 NF)
label:LABEL: CodeStructure
description: A database normalization form that removes transitive dependencies, ensuring that non-key attributes are not dependent on other non-key attributes.

name: Fifth Normal Form (5 NF)
label:LABEL: CodeStructure
description: A database normalization form that ensures that every join dependency in the table is a consequence of the candidate keys.

name: singleton pattern
label:LABEL: DesignPattern
description: A design pattern that restricts a class to a single instance and provides a global point of access to it.

name: factory pattern
label:LABEL: DesignPattern
description: A creational design pattern that provides an interface for creating objects in a superclass but allows subclasses to alter the type of objects that will be created.

name: Quality of Service (QoS)
label:LABEL: CodeStructure
description: A set of technologies that manage data traffic to reduce packet loss, latency, and jitter on a network.

name: Frequency Division Multiple Access (FDMA)
label:LABEL: DesignPattern
description: A channel access method used in multiple-access protocols that allows multiple users to access the same frequency band by dividing it into smaller frequency bands.

name: Time Division Multiple Access (TDMA)
label:LABEL: DesignPattern
description: A channel access method that allows multiple users to share the same frequency channel by dividing the signal into different time slots.

name: Space Division Multiple Access (SDMA)
label:LABEL: DesignPattern
description: A method of allowing multiple users to share the same frequency channel by using spatial separation.

name: Hierarchy of Abstraction
label:LABEL: CodeStructure
description: An organized structure of different levels of abstraction, which can be sequential or tree-structured.

name: Application Programming Interface (API)
label:LABEL: CodeStructure
description: A standard interface that allows different software components to communicate, enhancing portability and integration.

name: Finite State Machine (FSM)
label:LABEL: DesignPattern
description: A computational model used to design algorithms and systems that can be in one of a finite number of states at any given time.

name: State Transition Function
label:LABEL: CodeStructure
description: A function that defines how the FSM transitions from one state to another based on input symbols.

name: Output Function
label:LABEL: CodeStructure
description: A function that produces output based on the current state and input symbol in an FSM.

name: State Table
label:LABEL: CodeStructure
description: A tabular representation of the state transitions and outputs for an FSM, providing a clear overview of its behavior.

name: Grammar
label:LABEL: DesignPattern
description: A formal set of rules that defines the structure of a language, applicable in programming language design and compilers.

name: Validity
label:LABEL: QualityAttribute
description: The degree to which a measurement method accurately measures the concept it is intended to measure.

name: Measurement Method
label:LABEL: DesignPattern
description: A defined operation that yields a symbol as part of the measurement of an attribute.

name: Iterative Design Process
label:LABEL: DesignPattern
description: A design pattern that emphasizes repeated cycles of prototyping, testing, and refining solutions.

name: Wicked Problem
label:LABEL: DesignPrinciple
description: A concept in design that refers to complex problems that are difficult to define and have no clear solution.

name: Modeling
label:LABEL: DDDConcept
description: The process of creating abstract representations of a system to understand its behavior and relationships.

name: Iconic Model
label:LABEL: DesignPattern
description: A visually equivalent but incomplete representation of a system, useful for understanding physical aspects.

name: Analogic Model
label:LABEL: DesignPattern
description: A functionally equivalent but incomplete representation that behaves like the physical artifact.

name: Symbolic Model
label:LABEL: DesignPattern
description: A higher level of abstraction using symbols to model processes or systems, aiding in understanding and prediction.

name: Discrete Simulation
label:LABEL: DesignPattern
description: A type of simulation focusing on event scheduling and modeling discrete events in software engineering.

name: ISO/IEC 27000
label:LABEL: QualityAttribute
description: A family of standards focused on information security management systems, relevant for ensuring software security.

name: Model-Based Systems and Software Engineering (MBSSE)
label:LABEL: ArchPattern
description: An approach that integrates model-based techniques into systems and software engineering processes.

name: Continuous Improvement
label:LABEL: DesignPrinciple
description: A principle emphasizing ongoing enhancements in all aspects of the software life cycle.

name: ISO/IEC 25010
label:LABEL: QualityAttribute
description: A standard that defines quality characteristics for software products, including maintainability, performance, and security.

name: ISO/IEC 12207
label:LABEL: ArchPattern
description: A standard for software life cycle processes, providing a framework for software development and maintenance.

name: ISO/IEC 14764
label:LABEL: ArchPattern
description: A standard that outlines software maintenance processes, ensuring the continued performance and reliability of software.

name: ISO/IEC/IEEE 42010:2022
label:LABEL: ArchPattern
description: Standard for architecture description, providing a framework for describing the architecture of software systems.

name: ISO/IEC/IEEE 42020:2019
label:LABEL: ArchPattern
description: Standard for architecture processes, outlining processes for developing and managing architecture.

name: ISO/IEC/IEEE 42030:2019
label:LABEL: ArchPattern
description: Framework for architecture evaluation, providing guidelines for assessing software architecture.

name: Work Breakdown Structure
label:LABEL: CodeStructure
description: A hierarchical decomposition of tasks required for a project iteration, aiding in task organization and scheduling.
source: Systems Analysis and Design in - John W. Satzinger, Robert B. Ja.pdf

name: Supplier Information Subsystem

name: Component Integration

name: Application Components

name: Third Normal Form (3NF)
